text: Qualification for table tennis at the 2020 Summer Paralympics begin on 1 January 2019 and ends on 31 March 2021. There are 174 male athlete and 106 female athlete quotas in 31 events for the sport. ==Timeline== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Competition !! Date !! Venue !! Berths |- | 2019 ITTF Oceania Para Championships || 1 - 4 May 2019 || Darwin ||rowspan=5 align="center"|150 qualified slots 55 male 50 female |- | 2019 ITTF African Para Championships || 30 June - 3 July 2019 || Alexandria |- | 2019 ITTF Asian Para Championships || 23 - 27 July 2019 || Taichung |- | 2019 Parapan American Games || 22 - 27 August 2019 || Lima |- | 2019 ITTF European Para Championships || 16 - 21 September 2019 || Helsingborg |- | ITTF PTT World Qualification Tournament || 9 - 11 May 2021 || Laško ||align="center"|21 qualified slots 11 males 10 females |- | World Ranking Allocation || 1 January 2019 – 31 March 2020 || — ||align="center"|100 qualified slots 72 males 28 females |- | Bipartite Commission Invitation || 15 - 30 April 2021 || - ||align="center"|50 qualified slots 36 males 14 females |- ! Total || || || align="center"| 280 |} ==Quotas== The qualification slots are allocated to the individual athlete not the NPC that they represent. * An NPC can enter a maximum of three athletes in any of each individual medal event (33 male; 30 female). * An NPC can enter one team (minimum of two, maximum of three from individual events) in any of each team event. ===Men's events=== As of August 2020. ;Class 1 {| class="wikitable" |- !
